meanings.definition: The process of preserving a dead body by embalming and drying it to prevent decay.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians practiced mummification to keep bodies from rotting.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the art of mummification in their special exhibit.
meanings.sent3: During the mummification process, the body looked like a human-shaped statue.
meanings.sent4: The mummification of history helps us remember the past more vividly.
meanings.sent5: The mummification of the pharaoh was a meticulous and respectful procedure.

meanings.definition: The act of mummifying a body for burial.
meanings.sent1: After the mummification, the body was ready for its final resting place.
meanings.sent2: The priest performed the mummification ceremony with great care.
meanings.sent3: The mummification process was like a farewell gift to the deceased.
meanings.sent4: The mummification ritual symbolized the transition to the afterlife.
meanings.sent5: The mummification of the king was a solemn event attended by many.

meanings.sent1: The mummification of the body was a sign of respect in their culture.
meanings.sent2: The mummification of the pharaoh was a symbol of power and eternity.
meanings.sent3: The mummification of the queen made her look like a sleeping beauty.
meanings.sent4: The mummification process turned the body into a timeless relic.
meanings.sent5: The mummification of the nobleman was a fascinating sight for the villagers.
